intro: Lagenophora billardierei var. montana, commonly known as the mountain lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats, such as heathlands and woodlands. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
